**Einstein**: Albert Einstein is one of the most influential scientists in history. His theory of relativity revolutionized our understanding of space, time, and gravity. Swapping places with Einstein would allow me to witness the development of his theories and to be a part of the scientific discoveries that have shaped our understanding of the universe.

**J.K. Rowling**: As the author of the Harry Potter series, J.K. Rowling has created a magical world that has captivated millions of readers worldwide. Swapping places with her would give me the opportunity to be a part of the creative process behind one of the most successful book series of all time and to experience the joy of storytelling on a global scale.

**Steve Jobs**: As co-founder of Apple, Steve Jobs was instrumental in the development of many groundbreaking technologies. Swapping places with him would allow me to be a part of the creation of the iPhone, iPad, and Macintosh, and to witness the evolution of technology and the impact it has had on our daily lives.

**Mahatma Gandhi**: Mahatma Gandhi was a leading figure in the Indian independence movement. His philosophy of nonviolent resistance has inspired countless movements for civil rights and freedom around the world. Swapping places with him would allow me to experience firsthand the struggle for independence and to understand the power of peaceful protest.

**Marie Curie**: As a pioneering physicist and chemist, Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the first person to win two Nobel Prizes in different fields. Swapping places with her would give me the opportunity to witness the discovery of radium and polonium, and to be a part of the development of nuclear physics.
